title: Expert Competency Enhancement for Family-Centered Approaches in Early Language Intervention

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced speech-language pathology coursework and substantial practical experience in language development disorders
context.additional_context: Customized Korean language course reflecting training requirements derived from research on Spanish-speaking professionals. VR simulations enable observation of real language delay cases and role-playing. Focuses on enhancing learners' grammar/vocabulary analysis skills and expression/comprehension strategies

learning_goals: Learners explain the philosophy and principles of the Family-Centered Approach (FCA) for language development support and apply them to real cases of language delay.
Learners perform FCA-based language intervention strategies in a simulated environment under expert supervision.

Learners observe three role-model cases for improving family relationships (e.g., communication skills, conflict resolution strategies, empathetic responses), attempt ≥2 collaborative dialogues with actual family members to promote language development, and achieve ≥20% improvement in pre-post relationship satisfaction surveys.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
